summary: Security vulnerability report for core-2.3.0.tgz containing 9 transitive dependencies with known CVEs, including high-severity remote code execution risk in eta (CVE-2022-25967, CVSS 8.8). Issue was automatically closed after vulnerabilities were resolved or removed from inventory.
userImpact: Users of the SDK are exposed to potential remote code execution and other high-severity vulnerabilities through transitive dependencies in the package tree.
rootCause: Outdated versions of transitive dependencies (eta, traverse, trim, http-cache-semantics, etc.) contain known security vulnerabilities that are not directly fixable without breaking upstream dependencies.
proposedFix: Upgrade vulnerable transitive dependencies to patched versions: eta >= 2.0.0, @babel/traverse >= 7.23.2, and update other affected packages to versions without known CVEs.
resolutionDetails: Issue was automatically closed when vulnerable libraries were either marked as ignored in the Mend inventory or removed from the package dependencies.
keyQuote: 9 vulnerabilities (highest severity is: 8.8) - CVE-2022-25967: RCE vulnerability in eta before 2.0.0
